summary: On May 4, 2022, Jeff and Julie Hodges discovered a box containing a firearm and miscellaneous items while clearing vegetation at their home. Investigator Carrie Fitz responded to the scene, collected the items, and submitted them for forensic testing. The items included a firearm, unfired cartridges, and Halloween masks, all of which were inventoried and sent to the ABC Forensic Services Laboratory.
conclusion: The collected items were submitted to the ABC Forensic Services Laboratory for forensic testing, and no further action was taken.

events.details: On May 4, 2022, Jeff and Julie Hodges discovered a box containing a firearm and miscellaneous items while clearing vegetation at their home at 620 Mason Street.
Investigator Carrie Fitz responded to the scene, collected the items as found, and returned them to the Bramblewood County Sheriff's Office for documentation and inventory.
On May 9, 2022, the collected items were transported to the ABC Forensic Services Laboratory for forensic testing.

description: Tattered black in color plastic bag
Black in color metal box with latch with interior containing insulated material and cardboard
Black in color Glock 17 pistol, 9x19 mm caliber (S/N: obliterated) and unloaded black in color Glock 9mm magazine
Seven stray bronze and silver in color 9mm unfired cartridges with Luger headstamp
Small white in color towel with reddish-brown in color stains
Black in color Halloween-type face mask with white in color eye rings
Black in color Halloween-type face mask with purple in color eye rings
